snippet: Officials said they would introduce legislation this week to increase oversight of programs that have taken advantage of Medicaid payments by luring relatively healthy clients.
abstract: New York City officials plan to introduce legislation to crack down on Medicaid-supported senior day care centers that lure relatively healthy clients with improper giveaways like free takeout food and cash; bill would set minimum safety and program standards, and would require the centers to register with the city's Department of Health and Mental Hygiene.
lead_paragraph: Officials said they would introduce legislation this week to increase oversight of programs that have taken advantage of Medicaid payments by luring relatively healthy clients.

headline.seo: City Council Measure Would Crack Down on Adult Day Care Centers
headline.main: Council Bill Would Crack Down on Proliferation of Adult Day Care Centers
headline.print_headline: Council Bill Would Crack Down on Proliferation of Adult Day Care Centers
